cabinetPositions.title: Commerce Secretary
cabinetPositions.description: The Commerce Department has been a perennial target for budget cuts, but the secretary oversees a diverse portfolio, including the census, the Bureau of Economic Analysis and the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration.

predictions.name: Wilbur Ross
predictions.description: Mr. Trump is expected to nominate Mr. Ross, an investor whose fortune is estimated by Forbes to be $2.9 billion. Mr. Ross has said  the United States must free itself from the “bondage” of “bad trade agreements,” and has advocated threats to impose steep tariffs on China.

cabinetPositions.title: Education Secretary
cabinetPositions.description: Mr. Trump has said he wants to drastically shrink the Education Department and shift responsibilities for curriculum research, development and educational aid to state and local governments.

predictions.name: Betsy DeVos
predictions.description: Mr. Trump has selected Ms. DeVos, a former chairwoman of the Michigan Republican Party and an education activist who is a passionate believer in school choice, as his nominee.

cabinetPositions.title: U.N. Ambassador
cabinetPositions.description: Second to the secretary of state, the United States ambassador to the United Nations will be the primary face of America to the world, representing the country’s interests at the Security Council on a host of issues, from Middle East peace to nuclear proliferation.

predictions.name: Nikki R. Haley
predictions.description: Mr. Trump has selected Ms. Haley, the governor of South Carolina, as his nominee. The daughter of immigrants from India, she was a prominent and frequent critic of Mr. Trump early in his run.

cabinetPositions.title: Secretary of Housing and Urban Development
cabinetPositions.description: The secretary oversees fair-housing laws, the development of affordable housing and access to mortgage insurance. As a real-estate developer, Mr. Trump is attuned to the tax breaks for housing development.

predictions.name: Ben Carson
predictions.description: Mr. Trump is nearing an announcement of the former neurosurgeon and presidential candidate to be his nominee to lead HUD.  Dr. Carson has said that he does not want to work in government, and it was not clear whether he had accepted the offer.

cabinetPositions.title: C.I.A. Director
cabinetPositions.description: Mr. Trump takes over at a time of diverse and complex threats to American security. The new C.I.A. director will have to decide whether to undo a C.I.A. “modernization” plan put in place this year by Director John O. Brennan, and how to proceed if the president-elect orders a resumption of harsh interrogation tactics — critics have described the tactics as torture — for terrorism suspects.

predictions.name: Mike Pompeo
predictions.description: Mr. Trump has selected Mr. Pompeo, Representative of Kansas and a former Army officer as his nominee. Mr. Pompeo is a member of the House Intelligence Committee and was a sharp critic of Hillary Clinton during the congressional investigation into the 2012 attack on the American diplomatic compound in Benghazi, Libya.

cabinetPositions.title: Attorney General
cabinetPositions.description: The nation's top law enforcement official will have the authority for carrying out Mr. Trump's “law and order” platform. The nominee can change how civil rights laws are enforced.

predictions.name: Jeff Sessions
predictions.description: of Alabama, as his nominee. Mr. Sessions is a strong proponent of strict immigration enforcement, reduced spending and tough-on-crime measures. His nomination for a federal judgeship in 1986 was rejected because of racially charged comments and actions, which are very likely to become an issue as he faces another set of Senate confirmation hearings.

cabinetPositions.title: National Security Adviser
cabinetPositions.description: The national security adviser, although not a member of the cabinet, is a critical gatekeeper for policy proposals from the State Department, the Pentagon and other agencies, a function that takes on more importance given Mr. Trump's lack of experience in elective office.

predictions.name: Michael T. Flynn
predictions.description: Mr. Trump has selected the retired Army lieutenant general and former director of the Defense Intelligence Agency. General Flynn has been outspoken about his view of the threat posed by Islamist militancy and was an ardent supporter of Mr. Trump during the campaign.

cabinetPositions.title: White House Chief of Staff
cabinetPositions.description: The chief of staff manages the work and personnel of the West Wing, steering the president's agenda and tending to important relationships. The role will take on outsize importance in a White House run by Mr. Trump, who has no experience in policy making and little in the way of connections to critical players in Washington.

predictions.name: Reince Priebus
predictions.description: Mr. Trump announced on Nov. 13 that he had chosen Mr. Priebus, the chairman of the Republican National Committee.

cabinetPositions.title: Chief Strategist
cabinetPositions.description: Stephen K. Bannon was also considered for chief of staff, but Mr. Trump instead named him chief strategist and senior counselor in the White House, saying that he and Mr. Priebus would be “working as equal partners” in the administration.

predictions.name: Stephen K. Bannon
predictions.description: Also on Nov. 13, Mr. Trump announced the appointment of Mr. Bannon, a right-wing media executive and the chairman of the president-elect’s campaign. Many have denounced the move, warning that Mr. Bannon represents racist views.

cabinetPositions.title: Secretary of State
cabinetPositions.description: Whether Mr. Trump picks an ideologue or a seasoned foreign policy hand from past Republican administrations, his challenge will be that the State Department is the centerpiece of the post-1945 experiment of alliance-building and globalism, which Mr. Trump said he would dismantle.

predictions.name: John R. Bolton
predictions.description: Former United States ambassador to the United Nations under George W. Bush

predictions.name: Bob Corker
predictions.description: Senator from Tennessee and chairman of the Senate Foreign Relations Committee

predictions.name: Rudolph W. Giuliani
predictions.description: Former New York mayor who campaign officials said is the leading contender for the job

predictions.name: John F. Kelly
predictions.description: A retired four-star Marine general whose son was killed in combat in Afghanistan

predictions.name: Zalmay Khalilzad
predictions.description: Former United States ambassador to Afghanistan

predictions.name: David H. Petraeus
predictions.description: Former four-star Army general and director of the Central Intelligence Agency, who resigned amid a scandal involving the mishandling of classified material.

predictions.name: Mitt Romney
predictions.description: The 2012 Republican presidential nominee and former governor of Massachusetts

cabinetPositions.title: Treasury Secretary
cabinetPositions.description: The secretary will be responsible for government borrowing in financial markets, assisting in any rewrite of the tax code and overseeing the Internal Revenue Service. The Treasury Department also carries out or lifts financial sanctions against foreign enemies — which are key to President Obama’s Iran deal and rapprochement with Cuba.

predictions.name: Thomas Barrack Jr.
predictions.description: Founder, chairman and executive chairman of Colony Capital; private equity and real estate investor

predictions.name: Jeb Hensarling
predictions.description: Representative from Texas and chairman of the House Financial Services Committee

predictions.name: Steven Mnuchin
predictions.description: Former Goldman Sachs executive and Mr. Trump's campaign finance chairman

predictions.name: Tim Pawlenty
predictions.description: Former Minnesota governor

cabinetPositions.title: Defense Secretary
cabinetPositions.description: The incoming secretary will shape the fight against the Islamic State while overseeing a military that is struggling to put in place two Obama-era initiatives: integrating women into combat roles and allowing transgender people to serve openly. Both could be rolled back.

predictions.name: Tom Cotton
predictions.description: Senator from Arkansas who saw combat in Iraq and Afghanistan as an Army infantry officer

predictions.name: Stephen J. Hadley
predictions.description: National security adviser under George W. Bush

predictions.name: Duncan Hunter
predictions.description: Representative from California and Marine reserve officer who served in Iraq and Afghanistan

predictions.name: Jon Kyl
predictions.description: Former senator from Arizona

predictions.name: James N. Mattis
predictions.description: Retired Marine Corps general and former head of United States Central Command

cabinetPositions.title: Director of National Intelligence
cabinetPositions.description: The person who holds this post is the president’s principal adviser on intelligence and oversees the entire military and civilian intelligence apparatus. The coordination between the intelligence agencies of the military and civilian wings will be vital for the war on the Islamic State.

predictions.name: Rudolph W. Giuliani
predictions.description: Former New York mayor

predictions.name: Michael S. Rogers
predictions.description: Navy admiral and director of the National Security Agency. Choosing Mr. Rogers may be complicated because the Obama administration is currently considering removing him after frustrations over the speed at which he moved to combat the Islamic State.

cabinetPositions.title: Interior Secretary
cabinetPositions.description: The Interior Department manages the nation’s public lands and waters. The next secretary will decide the fate of Obama-era rules that stop public land development; curb the exploration of oil, coal and gas; and promote wind and solar power on public lands.

predictions.name: Jan Brewer
predictions.description: Former governor of Arizona

predictions.name: Robert E. Grady
predictions.description: Gryphon Investors partner

predictions.name: Harold G. Hamm
predictions.description: Chief executive of Continental Resources, an oil and gas company

predictions.name: Forrest Lucas
predictions.description: President of Lucas Oil Products, which manufactures automotive lubricants, additives and greases.

predictions.name: Sarah Palin
predictions.description: Former governor of  Alaska

cabinetPositions.title: Agriculture Secretary
cabinetPositions.description: The agriculture secretary oversees America's farming industry, inspects food quality and provides income-based food assistance. The department also helps develop international markets for American products, giving the next secretary partial responsibility to carry out Mr. Trump's positions on trade.

predictions.name: Sam Brownback
predictions.description: Kansas governor

predictions.name: Chuck Conner
predictions.description: Chief executive officer of the National Council of Farmer Cooperatives

predictions.name: Sid Miller
predictions.description: commissioner of agriculture for Texas

predictions.name: Sonny Perdue
predictions.description: Former governor of Georgia

cabinetPositions.title: Labor Secretary
cabinetPositions.description: The Labor Department enforces rules that protect the nation’s workers, distributes benefits to the unemployed and publishes economic data like the monthly jobs report. The new secretary will be in charge of keeping Mr. Trump’s promise to dismantle many Obama-era rules covering the vast work force of federal contractors.

predictions.name: Victoria A. Lipnic
predictions.description: Equal Employment Opportunity commissioner and workforce policy counsel to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.

predictions.name: Andrew F. Puzder
predictions.description: Mr. Trump’s expected choice is the chief executive of CKE Restaurants — and a donor to his campaign — who has criticized the Obama administration’s labor policies.

cabinetPositions.title: Health and Human Services Secretary
cabinetPositions.description: The secretary will help Mr. Trump achieve one of his central campaign promises: to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act. The department approves new drugs, regulates the food supply, operates biomedical research, and runs Medicare and Medicaid, which insure more than 100 million people.

predictions.name: Mike Huckabee
predictions.description: Former Arkansas governor and 2016 presidential candidate

predictions.name: Bobby Jindal
predictions.description: Former Louisiana governor who served as secretary of the Louisiana Department of Health and Hospitals.

predictions.name: Tom Price
predictions.description: Representative from Georgia

predictions.name: Rick Scott
predictions.description: Florida governor and former chief executive of a large hospital chain

cabinetPositions.title: Energy Secretary
cabinetPositions.description: Despite its name, the primary purview of the Energy Department is to protect and manage the nation’s arsenal of nuclear weapons.

predictions.name: James L. Connaughton
predictions.description: Chief executive of Nautilus Data Technologies and former environmental adviser to President George W. Bush.

predictions.name: Robert E. Grady
predictions.description: Gryphon Investors partner

predictions.name: Harold G. Hamm
predictions.description: Chief executive of Continental Resources, an oil and gas company

cabinetPositions.title: Secretary of Veterans Affairs
cabinetPositions.description: The secretary will face the task of improving the image of a department Mr. Trump has widely criticized. Mr. Trump repeatedly argued that the Obama administration neglected the country's veterans, and he said that improving their care was one of his top priorities.

predictions.name: Scott Brown
predictions.description: Former senator from Massachusetts

predictions.name: Jeff Miller
predictions.description: representative from Florida who was chairman of the House Veterans Affairs Committee

cabinetPositions.title: Homeland Security Secretary
cabinetPositions.description: The hodgepodge agency, formed after the attacks of Sept. 11, 2001, has one key role in the Trump administration: guarding the United States’ borders. If Mr. Trump makes good on his promises of widespread deportations and building a wall, this secretary will have to carry them out.

predictions.name: Joe Arpaio
predictions.description: Departing sheriff of Maricopa County, Ariz

predictions.name: David A. Clarke Jr.
predictions.description: Milwaukee County sheriff

predictions.name: Rudolph W. Giuliani
predictions.description: Former mayor of New York

predictions.name: John F. Kelly
predictions.description: A retired four-star Marine general whose son was killed in combat in Afghanistan

predictions.name: Kris Kobach
predictions.description: Kansas secretary of state and a top adviser to Mr. Trump on his hard-line immigration policies

predictions.name: Michael McCaul
predictions.description: Representative from Texas and chairman of the House Homeland Security Committee

cabinetPositions.title: E.P.A. Administrator
cabinetPositions.description: The Environmental Protection Agency, which issues and oversees environmental regulations, is under threat from the president-elect, who has vowed to dismantle the agency “in almost every form.”

predictions.name: Myron Ebell
predictions.description: A director at the Competitive Enterprise Institute and a prominent climate change skeptic.

predictions.name: Robert E. Grady
predictions.description: Gryphon Investors partner who was involved in drafting the Clean Air Act Amendments of 1990.

predictions.name: Jeffrey R. Holmstead
predictions.description: Lawyer with Bracewell L.L.P. and former deputy E.P.A. administrator in the George W. Bush administration.

predictions.name: Scott Pruitt
predictions.description: Mr. Trump has selected the Oklahoma attorney general, who is a close ally of the fossil fuel industry.

cabinetPositions.title: U.S. Trade Representative
cabinetPositions.description: The president’s chief trade negotiator will have the odd role of opposing new trade deals, trying to rewrite old ones and bolstering the enforcement of what Mr. Trump sees as unfair trade, especially with China.

predictions.name: Dan DiMicco
predictions.description: Former chief executive of Nucor Corporation, a steel production company, and a critic of Chinese trade practices.

cabinetPositions.title: Transportation Secretary
cabinetPositions.description: The next transportation secretary will oversee Mr. Trump’s campaign pledge to increase infrastructure funding to rebuild America's roads, bridges, airports and transit systems.

predictions.name: Elaine L. Chao
predictions.description: Mr. Trump has selected Ms. Chao, the labor secretary under President George W. Bush. Ms. Chao, who is married to the Senate majority leader, Mitch McConnell, has been a fixture of the Republican establishment in Washington.
